decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Prior to the commencement of phases 1, 2 and 3 samples of the materials to be used in the construction of that phase shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 3 - Phase 1 of the development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted C054C, C070B, C071A, 077A, 078A (received 26/08/2014) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.  
Phase 2 of the development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted 154-4 floor plans, 0151-5 north and west elevations, AC91/35B north and west elevations, AC91/34C south and east elevations, AC91/41 plant room elevations, AC91/33A first floor plan, AC91/32A ground floor plan (received 08/02/2010), 074A, (received 26/08/2014), 079A (received 17/09/2014) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.
Phase 3 of the development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted 154-4 floor plans, 0151-5 north and west elevations, AC91/35B north and west elevations, AC91/34C south and east elevations, AC91/41 plant room elevations, AC91/33A first floor plan, AC91/32A ground floor plan (received 08/02/2010) and 074A (received 26/08/2014) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 4 - No development shall take place until the car parking spaces have been laid out within the site in accordance with drawing A054C (received 26/08/2014). Development of phase 2 shall not commence until the car parking spaces have been laid out in accordance with drawing AC91/32A (received 08/02/2010).

Condition : 5 - Prior to the commencement of phases 1, 2 and 3 full details of both hard and soft landscape works shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority and these works shall be carried out as approved.  These details shall include (proposed finished levels or contours; means of enclosure; car parking layouts; other vehicle and pedestrian access and circulation areas; hard surfacing material; minor artefacts and structures (eg. furniture, play equipment, refuse or other storage units, signs, lighting etc); proposed and existing functional services above and below ground (eg drainage power, communications cables, pipelines etc. indicating lines, manholes, supports etc); retained historic landscape features and proposals for restoration, where relevant).  Soft landscape works shall include (planting plans; written specifications (including cultivation and other operations associated with plant and grass establishment); schedules of plants, noting species, plant sizes and proposed numbers/densities where appropriate; implementation programme).  The landscaping shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of the development for that phase.

Condition : 6 - Prior to the commencement of phases 1, 2 and 3 a landscape management plan, including long term design objectives, management responsibilities and maintenance schedules for all hard and soft landscape areas, shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to the occupation of the development or any phase of the development, whichever is the sooner, for its permitted use.  The landscape management plan shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 7 - Prior to the commencement of phases 1, 2 and 3 a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected shall be submitted and approved by the local planning authority.  The boundary treatment shall be completed before that phase is occupied.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 8 - If within a period of (two years) from the date of the planting of any tree, that tree, or any tree planted in replacement for it, is removed, uprooted or destroyed or dies, (or becomes, in the opinion of the local planning authority, seriously damaged or defective,) another tree of the same species and size as that originally planted shall be planted at the same place, unless the local planning authority gives its written consent to any variation

Condition : 9 - Phase 1 shall not be occupied until a means of access for pedestrians  has been constructed in accordance with drawing A054C (received 26/08/2014).  Phase 2 shall not be occupied until pedastrian access has been constructed in accordance with drawing AC91/32A (received 08/02/2010).
Condition : 10 - The premises shall be used for a children's nursery and community hall, and for no other purpose.  No wedding receptions are permitted.

Condition : 11 - The use of the children's nursery and community hall shall not be carried on other than between 08.00 and 22.00 hours on any day including Sundays and Bank Holidays, except in accordance with any consent that may be given in advance and in writing by the Local Planning Authority
Condition : 12 - No additional floorspace shall be formed within the building hereby permitted by means of horizontal subdivision except with the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority

Condition : 13 - No development shall be carried out before details of a scheme have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority covering (i) any additional external illuminate of the site, (ii) measures to ensure that, during the period of construction, mud and other loose materials are not carried onto the public highway on the wheels or chassis of any vehicle leaving the site and (iii) measures to minimise dust caused by building operations and ensure that no dust or debris is carried onto the adjacent property.

Condition : 14 - Prior to the commencement of phases 1, 2 and 3 arrangements for storage of waste and recycled materials shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  The arrangements for storing waste and recycled materials shall not be carried out other than in accordance with any approval given and shall be completed before that phase is occupied.

Condition : 15 - No development shall take place within the site until the applicants, their agents or any successor in title has secured the implementation of a program of archaeological works in accordance with a written scheme of investigation - including a timetable for investigation which has been submitted to the local planning authority and approved in writing.

Condition : 16 - The proposal shall be implemented in accordance with the phasing shown in drawing A055D (received 26/08/2014) submitted with the application, including the method statement for the demolition, storage and rebuilding of the porch.
description: Variation of Condition 2 (external materials), 3 (plans), 4 (parking), 5 (soft & hard landscaping), 6 (landscape management plan), 7 (boundary treatment) and 14 (waste storage) to allow phased development of planning permission 00214/G/P2 dated 08/03/2013
